name: Rum Doodle Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute you walk up the steps to the front entrance of the property and ring on the bell, you are greeted by a warm welcome and sense of homeliness. The hosts are wonderful: helpful yet un-intrusive. The house itself is a concoction of eclectic furnishings: from a moustache-shaped front door mat to a quirky hat display that creates the lighting in the hallway, to a range of individually decorated bedrooms, each with their own character. The food is divine, we have never tasted such quality in such a relaxed atmosphere. The location couldn't be better, equidistant from Windermere and Bowness and just a short drive, bus or boat trip to Ambleside. We also drove to Keswick and Grasmere with ease. If you are looking for a relaxed break, in a property that offers atmosphere, comfort and luxury, a class above the standard B&B, you will struggle to pick fault with this guesthouse. A truly wonderful stay - thank you!
reviews.title: A quirky gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were booked into Rum Doodle in September as a wedding gift from his sister. Whilst we only stayed for 2 nights, the whole experience was so lovely. The B&B is decorated with really great taste throughout, the family-run service is friendly and helpful and the breakfast is to die for! 100% recommended!
reviews.title: Gorgeous quirky B&B in beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our second wedding anniversary trip here over the Easter Weekend and are so glad we chose to stay. The B&B lives up to every review and photo and then some! We were greeted with fresh out of the oven Hot Cross Buns and a well needed pot of tea. When we went into our room there was a lovely surprise of mini-eggs and a large Easter Egg filled with lots of goodies from a nearby chocolatier.
reviews.title: Cute, comfy & cozy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in Room 8 (Burley) and the final night in Room 2 (Jungle) and both were comfortable and beautifully decorated with some gorgeous vintage pieces. Breakfast each day was incredible and the Blueberry Pancakes are highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent value and highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Emma & Gregor were amazing hosts and were friendly and helpful. Definitely take on board their restaurant recommendations. You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: I want to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having honeymooned in the Lake District 5 years ago we returned for an anniversay break and chose the Rum Doodle for a 2 night stay based on the excellent reviews and the quirky 'quintessentially english' theme.
reviews.title: Anniversary break

reviews.text: We couldn't have been more happy with our choice! After a stressful morning with adverse weather conditions affecting our route to Windermere, we were most thankful for the warm reception and home baked cake and tea!!
reviews.title: top end bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in 'The Summit' (room 9) and found this to be spacious, warm and homely and very comfortable as well as being beautifully presented.
reviews.title: Wonderful and welcoming
Perfect B&B
reviews.text: We both agreed the breakfasts were as good as any 5* establishment we have stayed in and service during this time was personal and attentative.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We look forward to returning in the future.
reviews.title: Gorgeous B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we stayed here during our Honeymoon in England last month ... I was slightly skeptical about staying at a BnB cuz I've never done it before but their website and reviews were pretty interesting...so we went ahead. I have to say it was the best place we stayed at during our 10 day trip to England ... the rooms, the owners, the location of this place, their breakfast and their stories are absolutely something to experience it yourself.
reviews.title: A gem in Lake District!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anybody who wants to goto Lake District for a romantic holiday shouldn't think twice to stay here.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is ideal. We booked the small double room, and yes it is small but you only sleep there & its cheaper than the rest of the rooms. Lovely, friendly hosts who offered fresh coffee & cake on arrival & accommodated our request for an early breakfast one day. Free parking, close enough to Bowness. There is nothing to fault about this place.
reviews.title: Fab stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Rum Doodle recently. We stayed in room 7 which was nicely decorated and clean. We were the only guests on the Thursday night so had the breakfast area to ourselves on Friday. Breakfast was delicious, cooked Friday, salmon on Saturday. Emma gave us a friendly welcome and recommended a great walk starting from Grasmere. I would recommend staying in Rum Doodle and hopefully we will do so again in the future.
reviews.title: 2 Night Stay

reviews.text: Had a lovely stay at Rum Doodle, the hotel was full of character but without over trying, superb owners and staff, breakfast was quality, all freshly made and just spot on. The hotel has a very relaxed atmosphere and I would definately return without a doubt, if you are thinking of trying it you will not be disappointed I assure you.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: What a warm, friendly, superbly well run B&B situated within easy walking distance of both Windermere and Bowness. Emma and Gregor truly are the best of hosts; from the warm welcome to the cheery farewells, nothing was too much trouble for them throughout our stay. As soon as you arrive, you can see the love, care and attention they put into the place throughout and that’s what makes this B&B stand out.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B with truly wonderful hosts!

reviews.text: We booked the Shute room for three nights with our 2 year old daughter, a large airy room with very comfortable four poster bed and a breakfast table situated in the large bay window. We were delighted to find a selection of children’s books and a place setting with kiddie tableware. With so many places claiming to be child friendly, it was an absolute breath of fresh air to find Emma and Gregor truly were, as they welcomed our little one with open arms and ensured she felt as welcome as we certainly did.
reviews.title: Warmest Welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With tea and homemade cake in the afternoon and a complimentary bottle of very nice house red, we felt really spoilt! Breakfast was superb with a wide array of dishes available. My wife alternated between the banana and blueberry pancakes and the banana and almond porridge and enjoyed both equally. After tasting the full English on the first day, I stuck with that for the duration – extremely tasty and well cooked with a perfectly poached egg on each occasion!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you can pretty much guess, we had a fantastic stay at Rum Doodle and wish we’d been able to stay for longer; it really was a home from home. Thank you Emma and Gregor for making it a lovely stay!
reviews.title: Second Stay at Rum Doodle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Rum Doodle mid week. Had the warmest welcome from the owners and we had a wonderful stay. The breakfasts are amazing and the pancakes are hevenly. We would stay again without a doubt.
reviews.title: Lovely birthday

description: Set midway between Windermere and Bowness this luxury guest house is just a short stroll away from Lake Windermere, the Lake District, Cumbria and Englands largest lake. Breamount guest house offers that extra bit of everything for that luxury romantic break from four poster beds, pleasant gardens, use of leisure club with jacuzzi, sauna, swimming pool and gym to complimentary tea and scones on arrival (wine & chocs for those arriving later in the day)
